intro: Aulomyrcia multiflora, commonly known as the Brazilian rosewood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with numerous leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in musical instrument making, it is a subject of conservation interest.
